meta.title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
meta.author: Sarah J. Maas

1.description: Nineteen-year-old huntress who hunts to feed her impoverished family. Skilled archer living in a cabin near the Wall.

5.description: Killed a massive wolf (later revealed as a faerie) while hunting. Taken to the Spring Court as consequence for breaking the Treaty.

12.description: Learning to read and discovering her artistic talents while staying in the Spring Court. Growing closer to Tamlin.

25.description: Accepts her love for Tamlin and becomes fully involved in the Spring Court's fate. Determined to break the curse.

35.description: Agrees to Amarantha's bargain to save Tamlin. Must solve a riddle to free the Spring Court from the curse.

46.description: Solves the riddle, breaks the curse, and is killed and resurrected as High Fae. Becomes immortal with enhanced abilities.

5.description: Powerful faerie who appears as a beast-like creature with wolf and human features. Brings Feyre to his court as payment for killing Andras.

11.description: High Lord of the Spring Court under Amarantha's curse. Can only appear in his true faerie form at night.

18.description: Shows his true immortal faerie form to Feyre - devastatingly beautiful with pointed ears and green eyes. Reveals his deep loneliness and burden.

25.description: Desperately in love with Feyre but bound by the curse. Cannot tell her he loves her or the curse will never break.

33.description: Taken Under the Mountain by Amarantha. Tortured and forced to watch Feyre endure the trials.

46.description: Freed from Amarantha's curse when Feyre solves the riddle. Restored to his full power as High Lord of Spring.

33.description: Mysterious and powerful High Lord of the Night Court. Appears at Amarantha's court with dark beauty and violet eyes.

35.description: Makes a bargain with Feyre to save her life after she's nearly killed in the first trial. Demands one week per month with her.

40.description: Forces Feyre to dance and drink wine at Amarantha's parties, causing her to black out. His motives remain unclear.

44.description: Subtly helps Feyre solve the final riddle by guiding her thoughts. Has been protecting her all along.

46.description: Revealed to have been protecting Feyre throughout her trials. Helps bring her back to life as High Fae.

5.description: Red-haired faerie with fox-like features and a mechanical golden eye. Tamlin's emissary and closest friend.

10.description: Lost his eye in a brutal encounter. Wears a golden mechanical replacement. Shows fierce loyalty to Tamlin.

15.description: Reveals he's originally from the Autumn Court but was cast out. Found sanctuary in the Spring Court.

25.description: Grows to care for Feyre and helps prepare her for the dangers ahead. Shows his protective nature.

33.description: Taken Under the Mountain with Tamlin. Forced to watch his friend's torment while being powerless to help.

20.description: Powerful sorceress who cursed the Spring Court. Rules from Under the Mountain with cruel authority.

33.description: Red-haired faerie of terrible beauty who holds court Under the Mountain. Keeps all High Lords under her power.

35.description: Offers Feyre a bargain - complete three tasks and solve a riddle to free Tamlin and the Spring Court.

42.description: Revealed to have been in love with Tamlin's father. Cursed the Spring Court in revenge after he rejected and killed her.

46.description: Killed by Tamlin when Feyre breaks the curse. Her death frees all the courts from her power.

1.description: Feyre's eldest sister, beautiful and sharp-tongued. Refuses to help with hunting or household work.

3.description: Bitter about their family's fall from wealth. Dreams of returning to their former status and comfort.

27.description: Shows concern when Feyre visits home, though she maintains her cold exterior. Notices Feyre's changes.

1.description: Feyre's middle sister, gentle and beautiful. Tends a small garden and dreams of marriage.

3.description: Engaged to Graysen, a merchant's son. Plans to marry and hopes to restore the family's fortunes through marriage.

27.description: Happy to see Feyre when she returns home. Shows genuine affection and concern for her sister.

1.description: Feyre's father, a former merchant who lost his fortune and ships. Now broken and unable to work due to injury.

2.description: Injured his leg badly in the attack that cost them their fortune. Cannot hunt or work, leaving Feyre to provide.

29.description: Shows some spirit when Feyre returns, asking questions about where she's been. Still weak but more alert.

6.description: Servant in Tamlin's manor who appears as an older woman with kind eyes. Takes care of Feyre's needs.

12.description: Teaches Feyre to read and helps her adapt to life in the Spring Court. Shows motherly concern for her.

20.description: Reveals the truth about the curse to Feyre. Has been waiting and hoping for someone to break it.

1.description: Large wolf that Feyre kills while hunting. Unusual in size and behavior for an ordinary wolf.

5.description: Revealed to have been a faerie in wolf form, serving the Spring Court. His death triggers the consequences for Feyre.

20.description: Was one of Tamlin's sentries, transformed by Amarantha's curse. Died protecting the borders of the Spring Court.

36.description: Ancient creature imprisoned Under the Mountain. Speaks in riddles and appears as whatever the viewer fears most.

37.description: Gives Feyre cryptic advice about her trials and the nature of love. Appears to know more than he reveals.

33.description: Horrifying winged creature that serves Amarantha. Has a woman's torso and head with bat-like wings.

36.description: Oversees Feyre's trials and delights in the suffering of others. Acts as Amarantha's enforcer.

18.description: Ancient faerie creature that must answer questions truthfully if caught. Appears as a horrifying winged being.

19.description: Tells Feyre crucial information about the curse and how it might be broken. Warns her of dangers ahead.

6.description: One of the servants in Tamlin's manor. Helps maintain the grounds and serves the household.
Another servant in the Spring Court manor. Works alongside Bron to maintain the estate.

3.description: Son of a local merchant, engaged to Elain. Considered a good match for the family's financial situation.

27.description: Still courting Elain and planning their wedding. Represents hope for the family's future prosperity.

3.description: Local man who shows interest in courting Nesta. Has a reputation that makes Feyre uncomfortable.

27.description: Still pursuing Nesta despite her family's changed circumstances. His persistence concerns Feyre.

1.description: Young man from the village who helps Feyre hunt sometimes. Shows romantic interest in her.

26.description: Greets Feyre warmly when she returns to the village. Still shows signs of his feelings for her.

15.description: High Lord of the Autumn Court and Lucien's father. Cast Lucien out of his court for unknown reasons.

33.description: Present Under the Mountain as one of the High Lords under Amarantha's control.
High Lord of the Day Court, known for his golden hair and warm personality. Trapped Under the Mountain.

46.description: One of the seven High Lords who gives part of his power to resurrect Feyre as High Fae.

33.description: High Lord of the Winter Court with silver hair and ice-blue eyes. Held captive Under the Mountain.

46.description: Contributes his power to bring Feyre back to life as High Fae after she dies breaking the curse.

33.description: Young High Lord of the Summer Court with blue-green hair and sea-colored eyes. Newest of the High Lords.

46.description: Joins the other High Lords in giving Feyre new life. Shows his generous and noble nature.

33.description: High Lord of the Dawn Court with healing powers. Known for his golden-brown skin and kind demeanor.

46.description: Uses his healing magic and life force to help resurrect Feyre. Shows compassion for her sacrifice.

42.description: Former High Lord of the Spring Court who rejected and killed Amarantha when she tried to seduce him. His actions led to the curse.
Former Lady of the Spring Court, killed along with her husband by Amarantha in revenge.
Tamlin's older brothers who were killed by Amarantha along with their parents. Their deaths made Tamlin the High Lord.

44.description: Rhysand's mother who was killed in a war. Her death deeply affected him and shaped his protective nature.
Rhysand's younger sister who was killed in the same war as their mother. Her death haunts him.

34.description: Ancient human commander who fought against the faeries. Now exists only as an eye in Amarantha's ring.

35.description: Forced to watch everything through Amarantha's ring. Witnesses all her cruelties and Feyre's trials.

42.description: Reveals his tragic history - was tricked into betraying the humans when Amarantha killed his faerie lover Clythia.
Lesser faerie who loved the human commander Jurian. Killed by Amarantha, leading to Jurian's downfall and capture.

35.description: Innocent human girl tortured and killed by Amarantha as punishment when Feyre fails to give the correct answer during the trials.

6.description: Cook in Tamlin's manor who prepares meals for the household. Part of the cursed Spring Court staff.
Various lesser faeries who serve in the Spring Court manor. All affected by Amarantha's curse.

25.description: All hoping for the curse to be broken so they can return to their true forms and normal lives.

10.description: Artist who created the beautiful paintings throughout Tamlin's manor. Reveals Feyre's potential artistic talents.

1.description: Local merchant who sometimes buys Feyre's hunted game. Provides income for the Archeron family.
Another merchant in the village who occasionally trades with Feyre for supplies and food.
Children from the village who sometimes see Feyre hunting. Represent the innocent life she's trying to protect.
Women of the village who gossip about the Archeron family's fall from grace. Often judge Feyre's hunting.

26.description: Notice Feyre's changed appearance when she returns, whispering about her new beauty and fine clothes.

1.description: Families living near the Archeron cottage who occasionally interact with them. Some offer help, others judge.
Man who occasionally sells firewood to the Archeron family when they can afford it.

33.description: Various faerie guards who serve Amarantha Under the Mountain. Enforce her will and maintain order.

36.description: Enormous worm-like creature that Feyre must kill in her first trial. Has acidic saliva and multiple rows of teeth.

33.description: Lesser faeries who serve as servants Under the Mountain. Tend to the needs of Amarantha and her court.

37.description: Magical creatures made of fire that Feyre encounters in her second trial. Must be avoided or they will burn her.

33.description: Various faeries who make up Amarantha's court Under the Mountain. Watch the trials and entertainment.
Faerie musicians who provide entertainment at Amarantha's court. Play during feasts and celebrations.

40.description: Professional dancers who perform at Amarantha's court. Feyre is forced to join them during her time Under the Mountain.
Servants who serve wine and other drinks at Amarantha's court. Often serve the drugged wine that makes Feyre forget.

5.description: Faeries who guard the borders of the Spring Court. Andras was one of them before being killed by Feyre.

32.description: Return to their duties after the curse is broken, helping to restore order to the Spring Court.

12.description: Faerie who maintains Tamlin's extensive library. Helps Feyre find books to improve her reading skills.

8.description: Faerie who cares for the horses and other animals in the Spring Court stables.

7.description: Faerie responsible for maintaining the beautiful gardens around Tamlin's manor.

10.description: Faerie with healing abilities who tends to injuries and illnesses in the Spring Court.

13.description: Fast faeries who carry messages between courts and deliver important communications.

14.description: Magical hounds used for hunting in the Spring Court. More intelligent than normal dogs.

8.description: Enchanted horses that are faster and stronger than normal horses. Used for travel in the Spring Court.

7.description: Ancient spirits that dwell in the forests around the Spring Court. Generally benevolent but mysterious.

17.description: Ghostly beings that inhabit the lakes and streams of the Spring Court territory. Generally avoid contact with others.

7.description: Tiny faeries that live within flowers and help them bloom. Part of the Spring Court's natural magic.

15.description: Invisible spirits that create music with the wind. Their songs can be heard throughout the Spring Court.

44.description: Mysterious servants who work for Rhysand. Appear as shadows that can gather information.

40.description: Mysterious musicians from the Night Court who play haunting melodies that affect the mind.

44.description: Rare faeries who can enter and manipulate dreams. Part of the Night Court's more mysterious powers.
Faeries whose power is strongest during the full moon. Connected to the Night Court's celestial magic.
Faeries who can read the stars and predict futures. Rare even within the Night Court.
Faeries who can manipulate darkness and shadows as tools or weapons. Elite guards of the Night Court.

35.description: Faeries who can communicate telepathically. Rhysand demonstrates this ability with Feyre during her trials.

38.description: Faeries who can sense lies and deception. Used by courts to determine honesty in important matters.
Ancient faeries who store and preserve important memories and knowledge. Living libraries of their courts.

36.description: Faeries who specialize in causing and manipulating pain. Used by Amarantha for torture and punishment.
Dark faeries who feed on fear and terror. Drawn to places of suffering like Under the Mountain.
Grim faeries who collect bones and remains. Serve Amarantha by cleaning up after her executions.
Faerie who records events in blood instead of ink. Keeps records of Amarantha's trials and punishments.

37.description: Faeries who create and manage various poisons and toxins. Serve Amarantha's court with deadly brews.

20.description: Powerful faeries who can create and forge curses. Helped Amarantha craft the curse on the Spring Court.
Faeries skilled in creating complex magical spells and enchantments. Some serve various courts.

33.description: The oldest and most powerful faeries, present Under the Mountain. Witness to ancient conflicts and treaties.

5.description: Ancient faeries who helped create the Treaty between the human and faerie realms. Their work governs interactions.

1.description: Powerful beings who maintain and guard the Wall between the human and faerie realms.

7.description: Spirits that embody the different seasons and help maintain the natural cycle. Connected to the seasonal courts.

33.description: Powerful faeries who command the basic elements - fire, water, earth, and air. Some serve the High Lords.

46.description: The most powerful healers who can actually restore life. The High Lords who brought Feyre back demonstrate this power.

44.description: Mysterious beings who can see and sometimes influence the threads of fate and destiny.

1.description: Elderly leader of the village who remembers when the Archeron family was wealthy.
Wise woman who provides herbal remedies and advice to village families.
Village blacksmith who repairs Feyre's hunting equipment and tools.

46.description: Beautiful priestess who officiates ceremonies in the Spring Court. Present at Feyre's revival as High Fae.

2.description: Papa Archeron's sister who occasionally checks on the family but offers little help in their poverty.
Feyre's deceased mother who died of typhus. Was determined to maintain the family's social status.

16.description: Dangerous creature that lurks in swamps and bogs. Feeds on those who venture too close to its territory.

15.description: Mischievous faerie creature that can take the form of animals, often leading travelers astray.

17.description: Mysterious floating lights that appear in marshlands, sometimes guiding travelers to safety or leading them to danger.

6.description: Small house faeries that help with domestic tasks in the Spring Court manor, invisible to most but felt in their helpful acts.

33.description: Terrifying headless faerie that serves as Amarantha's messenger of death. Appears as an omen of doom.
Vicious faeries with blood-red caps who serve in Amarantha's forces. Known for their brutality and love of violence.
Dark spirits that hunt for souls, drawn to places of death and suffering like Under the Mountain.

36.description: Ghostly woman whose wails foretell death. Her cries echo through Under the Mountain during the trials.

17.description: Dangerous water horse that lures riders to their deaths beneath the waves. Dwells in the deeper lakes of the Spring Court.

14.description: Massive black dog with glowing eyes that roams the wilder parts of the Spring Court territory. An omen of danger.

7.description: Ancient faerie folk who live in the hills and mounds around the Spring Court. Rarely seen but their presence is felt.

10.description: Inspiring faerie that grants artistic talent to humans in exchange for their life force. Connected to Feyre's newfound painting ability.

8.description: Large black cat with white chest marking that appears around the Spring Court manor. More intelligent than ordinary cats.

33.description: Malevolent faerie in red clothing who brings nightmares and terror. Serves in Amarantha's court of horrors.
Blood-drinking faerie with pale skin and red eyes. One of the more terrifying inhabitants of Under the Mountain.

36.description: Shape-shifting creature that can take the appearance of others. Used by Amarantha to confuse and torment prisoners.

20.description: Faerie child left in place of a human child. Part of old stories and treaties between human and faerie realms.

15.description: Mischievous red-capped faerie that plays practical jokes, sometimes harmless, sometimes cruel.

33.description: Sinister creature that can steal the essence or soul from living beings. One of Amarantha's more terrifying servants.

17.description: Half-woman, half-goat creature that guards water sources. Can be protective or dangerous depending on how she's approached.
Beautiful but dangerous sea faerie with a fish tail and green hair. Lives in the deeper waters near the Spring Court.
Faerie woman who can transform into a seal. Lives between land and sea, connected to both worlds.

18.description: Horrifying creature that appears as a skinless horse with a human torso. One of the most feared beings in faerie waters.

33.description: Malevolent dwarf-like creature that drinks blood and cannot be permanently killed. Serves in Amarantha's court.

recaps.1: Feyre Archeron hunts in the woods to feed her impoverished family, killing a large wolf that seems strangely intelligent.
recaps.2: The Archeron family struggles with poverty after losing their wealth. Feyre bears the burden of providing food while her sisters and father remain idle.
recaps.3: Nesta is courted by Tomas Mandray while Elain prepares for marriage to Graysen. The family dreams of restoring their lost fortune.
recaps.4: Feyre continues hunting despite the dangers, selling her kills to local merchants to keep her family fed through the harsh winter.
recaps.5: A powerful faerie named Tamlin arrives, demanding Feyre's life as payment for killing the wolf, who was actually his friend Andras in disguise.
recaps.6: Tamlin brings Feyre to his manor in the Spring Court, where she meets the servants and begins to adapt to faerie life.
recaps.7: Feyre explores the Spring Court grounds and begins to appreciate its beauty, though she remains wary of her captors.
recaps.8: Feyre learns more about faerie customs and begins training with weapons, slowly adjusting to her new life.
recaps.9: Tamlin's friend Lucien, with his mechanical golden eye, serves as emissary and watches over Feyre with suspicion.
recaps.10: Feyre discovers her artistic talents while learning to read, finding purpose and joy in painting for the first time.
recaps.11: The curse affecting the Spring Court is revealed - Tamlin can only appear in his true form at night.
recaps.12: Feyre's reading skills improve with help from Alis, and she grows closer to understanding the Spring Court's situation.
recaps.13: Tensions rise as Feyre learns more about the political situation between the courts and the mysterious threat Under the Mountain.
recaps.14: Feyre and Tamlin go hunting together, and she begins to see him as more than just her captor.
recaps.15: Lucien's tragic backstory is revealed - he was cast out from the Autumn Court and found refuge with Tamlin.
recaps.16: Feyre's archery skills impress the Spring Court, and she feels increasingly at home despite her initial captivity.
recaps.17: Feyre encounters the Suriel, an ancient creature, while exploring the Spring Court's vast territories.
recaps.18: The Suriel reveals crucial information about a curse affecting all the High Fae courts, warning Feyre of great danger ahead.
recaps.19: Feyre learns more about the faerie courts and their complex relationships, understanding the scope of the threat they face.
recaps.20: Alis reveals the truth about Amarantha's curse on the Spring Court and the impossible conditions for breaking it.
recaps.21: The curse's origins are explained - Amarantha's revenge for being spurned by Tamlin's father decades ago.
recaps.22: Feyre realizes the depth of Tamlin's sacrifice and the true nature of her role in potentially breaking the curse.
recaps.23: Growing feelings between Feyre and Tamlin complicate the situation as the curse's deadline approaches.
recaps.24: Feyre struggles with her human mortality and her place in the immortal faerie world.
recaps.25: Feyre and Tamlin finally acknowledge their love for each other, but the curse prevents him from saying it aloud.
recaps.26: Feyre visits her family to check on them, finding them well-provided for but changed by her absence.
recaps.27: Her sisters react with mixed emotions to Feyre's return, noticing her transformation and new beauty.
recaps.28: Feyre's father shows more life than before, and she realizes her family may not need her as much as she thought.
recaps.29: Despite her family's improved situation, Feyre knows her heart now belongs in the faerie realm with Tamlin.
recaps.30: Feyre returns to the Spring Court, fully accepting her feelings and ready to face whatever comes next.
recaps.31: Life in the Spring Court takes on new meaning as Feyre embraces her role and her love for Tamlin.
recaps.32: The approach of the curse's deadline creates mounting tension and urgency throughout the Spring Court.
recaps.33: Feyre is taken Under the Mountain to face Amarantha, meeting other High Lords including the mysterious Rhysand.
recaps.34: Amarantha's court is revealed in all its terrible glory, with various faeries trapped under her power.
recaps.35: Feyre accepts Amarantha's bargain to complete three trials and solve a riddle to save Tamlin and the Spring Court.
recaps.36: The first trial pits Feyre against a giant worm-like creature, testing her will to survive and kill.
recaps.37: Feyre barely survives the first trial with help from Rhysand, who makes his own bargain with her to ensure her survival.
recaps.38: Between trials, Feyre endures the horrors of Amarantha's court while trying to gather information.
recaps.39: The psychological torture of watching Tamlin suffer while being powerless to help takes its toll on Feyre.
recaps.40: Rhysand forces Feyre to dance and drink wine that makes her forget, though his true motives remain unclear.
recaps.41: The second trial involves navigating dangerous obstacles, testing Feyre's intelligence and courage.
recaps.42: Amarantha's tragic backstory is revealed - her love for Tamlin's father and the revenge that followed his rejection.
recaps.43: The final trial approaches as Feyre realizes the depth of the political and personal stakes involved.
recaps.44: Rhysand subtly helps Feyre understand the true nature of love, preparing her for the final riddle.
recaps.45: The riddle's answer comes to Feyre in a moment of clarity about the nature of love and sacrifice.
recaps.46: Feyre solves the riddle, dies in the process, and is resurrected as High Fae by the seven High Lords, breaking the curse forever.
